criteria: Prevention Strategies for Climate-Related Physical Conditions
Application of Prevention Strategies to Specific Scenarios
descriptions: Student does not identify any climate-related physical conditions.
Student identifies one climate-related physical condition, but does not describe its cause.
Student identifies one climate-related physical condition and briefly describes its cause.
Student identifies two climate-related physical conditions and describes their causes.
Student identifies three climate-related physical conditions and accurately describes their causes.
Student identifies multiple climate-related physical conditions, accurately describes their causes, and explains their physiological effects.
Student does not suggest any prevention strategies.
Student suggests one inadequate or inappropriate prevention strategy.
Student suggests one relevant prevention strategy.
Student suggests two relevant prevention strategies.
Student suggests three relevant and practical prevention strategies.
Student suggests multiple relevant, practical, and comprehensive prevention strategies, demonstrating a thorough understanding of protective measures.
Student does not apply prevention strategies to any scenarios.
Student attempts to apply prevention strategies but demonstrates misunderstanding.
Student applies prevention strategies to a scenario with limited success.
Student appropriately applies prevention strategies to a single scenario.
Student appropriately applies prevention strategies to multiple scenarios.
Student expertly applies prevention strategies to a variety of scenarios, adapting strategies based on context and demonstrating a nuanced understanding.
